Text: Membrane contact sites (MCS) are close appositions between two organelles. Ultrastructural studies typically reveal an intermembrane distance in the order of the size of a single protein (10 nm).

Text: Membrane contact site:  These zones of apposition are highly conserved in evolution but not much is understood about their biological meaning.

--------------------
Text: Membrane contact site:  These sites are thought to be important in mainly three cellular functions: they facilitate signalling, they promote the passage of ions, and they are the sites where the non-vesicular lipid trafficking from one cellular compartment to another occurs.
